topic.title: ZeroNet for Mobile?
topic.body: Is there anything like this for iOS and andriod?

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: This is pretty neat. Like our own slice of the internet. Away from all the normies. xD

1610219039_1KBdrQX71nWaR3P9DmNhJ6HSsBxS1.body:
> [tored](#comment_9_1AFhyYZbtHxkfMi9FCBnbJt5L8Rpt9X2Dn): there is an android app for sure, I don't know how well it works, but it is there.

cool. do you know the name? Or better yet, do you have a link to download it?

> [tored](#comment_10_1AFhyYZbtHxkfMi9FCBnbJt5L8Rpt9X2Dn): yea, if you look up "zeronet" on your phone and hit the first link, it takes you to zeronet.io, on which there is a "Download Android package (experimental)" button, you hit that, download the .apk, click it to install. You might need to allow app installs from unknown sources if prompted.

Thanks.

1617932358_18V3yAk827Q61WfYormvHGbKgDx3c.body:
Relying on anything that needs a server to work is a grave mistake. Use something like Jami: https://jami.net/
Or the upcoming Berty: https://berty.tech/
